p: In considering incidences ( P = 0.161) across HM subtypes, the sex ratios of men to women were different, as follows: in myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS), the sex ratio of men to women was 4:1 (8 men vs. 2 women). In multiple myeloma (MM), the sex ratio of men to women was 3:1 (10 men vs. 4 women). In acute myeloid leukaemia (AML), the sex ratio of men to women was 1: 1 (10 man vs. 8 women). In chronic myeloid leukaemia (CML), the sex ratio of men to women was 1:1 (4 men vs. 6 women). In acute lymphoid leukaemia (ALL), the sex ratio of men to women was 1:1 (2 men vs. 3 women) and in normal myelogram results the sex ratio was 1:1 (21 men vs. 21 women).
